title: Ancient Cellars 2012 One Toe Duck Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The scents mingle rose petals, sandalwood and a touch of bitter greens. That dusting of incense continues on the palate, with Indian spices and tart red fruit. Tannins are firm and proportionate, with a bit of stem flavoring the finish.

title: Bellingham 2013 The Bernard Series Bush Vine Pinotage (Coastal Region)
description: Graphite, char, vanilla bean and cedar plank lay atop the black berry and plum preserve fruit core on the nose. The palate is creamy and mouthfilling at first, offering rich notes of vanilla-infused stewed berries and raspberry sauce that are then overwhelmed by aggressive, green tannins that hold the palate hostage through the long, woody finish.

title: Cantina Produttori Bolzano 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Aromas of hazelnut, orchard fruit and a confectionary note lead the nose. The bright palate offers crisp green apple and lemon drop alongside zesty acidity that leaves a tangy finish.

title: Cantina Valle Isarco 2014 Aristos Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Its mix of heady aromas include chamomile flower, Spanish broom and yellow stone. The bright, fresh palate offers peach, pear, crunchy apple and a touch of mineral alongside vibrant acidity. It finishes crisp and clean.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Portas de Lisboa Red (Lisboa)
description: Fresh and fruity, this wine is full of generous red berry fruits. It is soft, open and ripe. With both Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, it does have some structure, just there to support the fruitiness of the wine. Drink now.

title: Castello di Spessa 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Scents of white flower, pear and a hint of ground almond emerge on this lively white. The vibrant palate offers green apple and a hint of mineral alongside racy acidity.

title: Borgo Conventi 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Aromas of hay, tomato leaf and medicinal herb lead the nose and follow over to the racy palate together with grapefruit, lemon drop and mineral. It's linear, with bracing acidity.

title: Bouchaine 2012 Pinot Noir (Carneros-Napa Valley)
description: Truffled earth and cranberry-strawberry envelop sizable oak and bittersweet tannin in this warm-vintage wine. On the more light-bodied side, it features savory tinges of black tea.

title: Colterenzio 2014 Weisshaus Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: Scents of apple blossom and citrus aromas are offered by this lively white and follow through to the zesty palate along with pear and nectarine. A mineral closes the finish.

title: Bürgermeister Willi Schweinhardt 2014 Rothenberg Riesling (Nahe)
description: While the nose is a bit subdued, suggesting bruised apple and herb notes, the palate of this spry, off-dry Riesling is fresh, fruity and elegant. Crisp white peach and grapefruit flavors are lively and tart, finishing with a refreshing green herb note. Drink now through 2018.

title: Shady Lane 2012 Estate Franc 'n' Franc Red (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: A blend of 57% Cabernet Franc, 26% Blaufränkish and 17% Merlot, this estate wine is overtly floral on the nose, with violet and earthy geranium on a bed of red berries. The palate is racy and lithe from pulsing acidity, yet flavors of juicy blueberry and red currant prevail and ultimately the grippy tannins balance it out.

title: White Oak 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Mostly Cabernet with smaller additions of Malbec, Petit Verdot, Merlot and Cabernet Franc, this wine opens with a toasty campfire aroma. It's otherwise marked by velvety tannin, tobacco leaf and cedar, remaining medium bodied through the finish.

title: Tenuta La Ponca 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)
description: Orchard fruit and citrus aromas emerge on this vibrant white while the slender, linear palate shows nectarine zest, apple and a hint of mineral. It's savory if a bit lean, with bracing acidity and lots of verve.

title: Terrazas de Los Andes 2014 Reserva Torrontés (Salta)
description: Tropical aromas of Moscatel grapes and lychee blend with a gritty, broken-down hint of oyster shell. This is oily and plodding, but with ample acidity. Pithy flavors of lemon, green melon and mango finish long, oily and slightly bitter.

title: Señorio del Tallar 2013  Ribera del Duero
description: Dark in color and inky on the nose, this smells oaky and a bit like plastic. On the palate, grabby tannins and heavy overall weight makes for a clumsy mouthfeel. Flavors of oak resin share the stage with blackberry fruit, while a sticky, tannic finish rates as chunky and chewy.

title: Kupel Wieser 2014 Alfio Moriconi Selection Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Pear, honeydew melon and floral note lift from the glass. The bright, no-frills palate offers up crisp apple and citrus peel while lively acidity provides a tangy finish.

title: La Crema 2013 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This wine shows wet cement, lime rinds, light honeysuckle and fragrant minerality on the nose. The texture is solidly grippy and intriguing once sipped, with flavors of yellow grapefruit pith and Gala apples in the midpalate, sliding into a lime-rind tang on the finish.

title: Poggiobello 2014 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This offers subdued aromas of elderflower, sage and a slight whiff of tomato vine while the crisp palate shows notes of mint and tropical fruit. Vibrant acidity gives it a clean, racy finish.

title: Primosic 2014 Poderi di Carlo Gmajne Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: This has a slightly copper hue and is delicately scented with aromas of hawthorn and orchard fruit. Its racy palate shows subtle notes of tangerine zest, lime and a hint of apple while a mineral note marks the finish.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Reserva Tinto Merlot (Tejo)
description: This is a young-colored wine that has been wood aged to smooth out the natural fruitiness of the Merlot. That gives the wine a smoky character with juicy acidity balanced by wood and toast flavors. The black plum flavors are rich, full in the mouth with a dry underlay of tannins. Drink from 2017.

title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2014 Branco Fernão Pires (Lisboa)
description: This is an attractively perfumed wine, full of citrus and white fruit flavors. Lemons and fresh grapefruit play with sliced apples and crisp Rocha pears to create a bright, lively wine that is ready to drink.

title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2012 Monge Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)
description: This is an attractively fruity, soft wine. Balanced between acidity and a lightly crisp texture, it has a touch of yeast although it's the fresh citrus fruit that dominates.

title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2012 Convento do Tomar Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: With ripe fruit and a light layer of tannins, this is a fruity wine, packed with red fruits and black cherry flavors. It has a dusty background that will allow it to age for a few more months. Drink from the end of 2016.

title: Plaisance Ranch 2013 Papa Joe's Private Stash Tempranillo (Applegate Valley)
description: Tart plum, tanned leather and tobacco scents push right into the flavor palate, along with coffee grounds, smoke and charred wood. Tempranillo is ascendent in Southern Oregon, and this makes the case for a Rioja-style, with similar dried fruit and woody tannins.

title: Torelló 2014 Malvarel-lo White (Penedès)
description: Melon, peach and tropical fruit aromas share the bouquet on this Malvasia-Xarello blend. A crisp, citrusy palate is lean, while tangerine, lime and melon flavors finish bright, with a moderate level of stony minerality.

title: Tramin 2014 Moriz Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: This lively white opens with aromas suggesting lemon blossom, orchard fruit, stone and citrus. On the invigorating palate, bracing acidity lifts yellow apple, nectarine and flinty mineral. It finishes on a tangy note.

title: Santa Julia 2014 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)
description: This racy Cab smells a touch scalped, with modest, slightly candied cherry and raspberry aromas. On the palate, this is balanced but basic. Flavors of plum, black currant and a dash of salt finish firm and warming.

title: 2 Lads 2013 Pinot Grigio (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: There's a nice weight and intensity to this wine, especially for a grape that is often deemed innocuous and light. Apple and pear skin tones offer tension to the fuzzy-textured palate, with a vein of citrus keeping everything in focus.

title: Ascevi Luwa 2014 Ceròu Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Citrus blossom and peach aromas open while the zesty palate offers rennet apple, lemon drop and almond. Crisp acidity and a mineral note lead to a tangy finish.

title: Collavini 2014 Friulano (Collio)
description: This lively white offers aromas of fragrant white flower, orchard fruit and crushed stone. The vibrant, linear palate delivers Anjou pear, citrus and an almond note alongside firm acidity.
